Animal biotelemetry as a discipline has matured, with telemetry data becoming essential for understanding the behaviour and social interactions, foraging ecology, resource selection, distribution and population dynamics of highly mobile and/or cryptic species [@Hooten:2017]. The use of animal-borne sensors have also gained prominence as a cost-effective approach for observing the World's oceans that compliments more traditional autonomous, ship-based and satellite observing platforms [@McMahon:2021].
